intro: Elatostema surculosum var. pedunculosum, commonly known as the creeping elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a distinctive red or purple calyx. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. This variant is distinguished by its elongated peduncles, which support its flowering clusters.
